Sentencas: A mathematical model predicting the performance of planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) has been developed.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model is fuel flexible, which implies not only pure H-2 but also any reformate composition (H-2, H2O, CO, CO2 and CH4) can be used as a fuel.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The important characteristic of this model is the consideration of reaction zone layers as finite volumes.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Reaction zone layers are thin layers in the vicinity of the electrolyte where electrochemical reactions takes place to produce electrons, oxide ions and water vapor (and/or carbon dioxide).
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the effect of Knudsen diffusion is accounted in the porous electrode (backing) and reaction zone layers.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model can predict the performance of SOFC at various operating and design conditions.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The predicted performance of SOFC is validated with the measured data found in the literature.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An excellent agreement is obtained between the predicted performance and the experimental results.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Moreover, the effect of various operating and design parameters on the performance of SOFC has been examined.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is found that the anode concentration overpotential in an anode-supported SOFC is about four orders of magnitude smaller than the anode ohmic overpotential even at higher current densities.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Further, it is found that the single largest contributor to the total cell potential loss is ohmic overpotential and hence it needs to be minimized to enhance the cell performance.
Titulo: Mathematical modeling of planar solid oxide fuel cells
